segments.text: What do we need for the barbecue ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , I ’ Ve bought a lot of meat . I ’ Ve got pork chops , small steaks , chicken wings and plenty of hot dog sausages and hamburger patties .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I can ’ t wait to start cooking . I ’ Ve bought the grill and charcoal.Do you have enough plates and utensils ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think so . I bought some paper plates and cups for people to use.It will save on the washing up .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: And if people drop them , they won ’ t break.We ’ ll need to buy some buns to make hot dogs and hamburgers .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: They sell them at the shop around the corner.We can go and get some in a few minutes .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I brought some cheese to make cheeseburgers and some onions for the hot dogs.We ’ ll need some tomato catchup and some barbecue sauce .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I have the sauce , but remind me to get some catchup at the shop .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: How long does it take to cook meat on the barbecue ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It only takes a few minutes.Some people like their meat well done , others like it rare.The great thing about the barbecue is that everyone can choose how they want their meat cooked .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: They can cook them themselves to make sure exactly how they like it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I hope you haven ’ t invited any vegetarians .
segments.speaker: S2
